newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai Oct CPI up 4.3 pct yr/yr, 0.5 pct mth/mth.
newsitem.headline: Thai Oct CPI up 4.3 pct yr/yr, 0.5 pct mth/mth.

text.p: The Thai consumer price index (CPI) rose 4.3 percent year-on-year in October and 0.5 percent month-on-month, the Commerce Ministry said on Friday.
The ministry said the 1990-based index rose 4.3 percent year-on-year in October to 135.7, up from its 130.1 level in October 1995.
The 0.5 percent month-on-month increase compared with a 0.1 percent rise in September over August, the ministry said.
The index rose 4.6 percent year-on-year in September.
The Thai Commerce Ministry issued the following economic indicators:
THAI CONSUMER PRICES Oct 96 Sept 96 Oct 95

NOTES: In the food and beverage category, vegetables and fruit prices rose 2.4 percent in October from September. Bread and flour products surged 4.7 percent, egg, dairy product and fresh food prices rose 0.4 percent, while prepared food items increased 0.6 percent. But meat, poultry and seafood prices fell 0.7 percent.

In the non-food group, costs of medical checks and other personal care services were unchanged, prices of cigarettes and alcoholic drinks rose 0.3 percent, while costs of entertainment, reading materials and education increased 0.4 percent.
